page.title: 10CHEESE-ROLLING,COOPERS HILL
page.content: TV means that thousands have heard of the ancient {cheese-rolling ceremony}. A round cheese is rolled down the hill - perhaps the yellow discs celebrated the midsummer sun in ancient times? The ceremony may have been started by the prehistoric inhabitants of the hill but it is almost certainly thousands of years old. Another {tradition} says that village maidens were rolled down the hill in wicker cages.They also use maypoles as part of their solstice celebrations. The ceremony moved to Whitsuntide in Saxon times and frenzied races are held at this time today,often with injuries. To win you have to run down the hill chasing a Double Gloucester cheese which weighs 8lb.Hundreds watch to see who gets down first and whether they are wounded or unscathed.
